arts.ttl: Blackburn boss John Eustace on Den defeat to Millwall
arts.sum: “The way we defended overall was very good but to concede in the last minute is very disappointing. “It was a big blow to lose Travis with 10, 15 minutes to go,” said Eustace.

arts.ttl: Blackburn Rovers' transfer argument strengthened as fine margins prove decisive

arts.ttl: The lowdown on Millwall 1 Blackburn 0 - Emakhu rewards caretaker Livermore after being handed first league start of campaign
arts.sum: Mihailo Ivanovic scored a 96th-minute winner as Millwall ended their three-game losing streak with a 1-0 win over Blackburn Rovers. Aidomo Emakhu came in for his first league start of the season and Joe Bryan returned in place of Danny McNamara.There was plenty of attacking intent from the home side, with Emakhu, Azeez and Esse all included in the starting 11.

arts.ttl: Mihailo Ivanovic strikes at the death to halt Blackburn’s winning run
arts.sum: Rovers had won their previous six matches.

arts.ttl: Former Millwall boss heads back to Lions’ Den on New Year’s Day
arts.sum: “I’m excited because it’s a really good group – most importantly to me it looks like a group that wants to work really hard to try and achieve success. He told BBC Radio Oxford: “I’m really excited to be here We’re at the stage where I just want to get to work, get on the training ground and meet the players, I’ve had more or less a year recharging my batteries but I’m ready to go.

arts.ttl: 'A bit strange' - Stand-in Millwall boss on Blackburn Rovers challenge
arts.sum: David Livemrore insists Millwall's full focus is on Blackburn Rovers as they continue to search for a new manager.
